head.title: Private Sector; Dollars to Doughnuts on Wall Street

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Private Sector; Dollars to Doughnuts on Wall Street

body.head.byline: By Jane L. Levere (Compiled by Rick Gladstone)

abstract.p: Krispy Kreme Doughnuts Inc will give away 40,000 'hot original glazed' doughnuts outside New York Stock Exchange when it stock begins trading there, moving from Nasdaq; photo (S)

block.p: Krispy Kreme Doughnuts Inc. has borrowed a line from a well-known competitor for its stock-listing switch from Nasdaq to the New York Stock Exchange: time to make the doughnuts.

This Thursday, Krispy Kreme will give away 40,000 ''hot original glazed'' doughnuts from a makeshift assembly-line kitchen outside the N.Y.S.E. building. Scott Livengood, Krispy Kreme's chairman and chief executive, praised Nasdaq, where his Winston-Salem, N.C.-based company went public last year in one of the most successful stock offerings. But he said the N.Y.S.E. was the ''most prestigious register of consumer brands in the world.''
Krispy Kreme Doughnuts Inc. has borrowed a line from a well-known competitor for its stock-listing switch from Nasdaq to the New York Stock Exchange: time to make the doughnuts.

This Thursday, Krispy Kreme will give away 40,000 ''hot original glazed'' doughnuts from a makeshift assembly-line kitchen outside the N.Y.S.E. building. Scott Livengood, Krispy Kreme's chairman and chief executive, praised Nasdaq, where his Winston-Salem, N.C.-based company went public last year in one of the most successful stock offerings. But he said the N.Y.S.E. was the ''most prestigious register of consumer brands in the world.''
Besides, it would be difficult to stage a doughnut giveaway outside Nasdaq, which has no trading floor.
